sen.j: 末吉孫左衛門（すえよし まござえもん、元亀元年（1570年） - 元和 (日本)3年3月26日 (旧暦)（1617年5月1日））は、江戸時代初期に朱印船貿易で活躍した大坂の大商人。
sen.e: Magozaemon SUEYOSHI, who lived from 1570 to March 26, 1617, was a great merchant who was very active in Shuinsen Boeki (trading by ships with a shogunal charter for foreign trade) during the early Edo period.
Magozaemon SUEYOSHI (1570 to May 1, 1617) was a great merchant in Osaka who was very active in Shuinsen Boeki (trading by ships with a shogunal charter for foreign trade) during the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を新暦に、「大阪」を追加しました。
sen.e: Magozaemon SUEYOSHI (1570 to May 1, 1617) was a great merchant in Osaka who was very active in Shuinsen Boeki (trading by ships with a shogunal charter for foreign trade) during the early Edo period.

sen.j: 京都・伏見の銀座の頭取の平野勘兵衛利方、後の末吉利方の長男に生まれた。
sen.e: He was born as the first child of Kanbe-Toshikata HIRANO, later Toshikata SUEYOSHI, who was todori (chief) of a ginza (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of silver) in Fushimi, Kyoto.

sen.e: He was born as the first child of Kanbe Toshikata HIRANO, later Toshikata SUEYOSHI, who was todori (chief) of a ginza (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of silver) in Fushimi, Kyoto.

sen.j: 徳川家康から朱印状を受け、「末吉船」とよばれる。
sen.e: Since he was granted a shuinjo (a shogunal license for foreign trade) by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA), his trading ship was called 'Sueyoshi Ship.'

sen.j: 大船を仕立てて、インドシナ・フィリピンなど南洋方面に出かけて貿易をした。
sen.e: He traded in big ships in the South Seas such as Indochina and the Philippines.

sen.j: 大坂の陣には家康のために働き、平野区、河内など2郡の代官となった。
sen.e: He participated in Osaka no Jin (The Siege of Osaka) for Ieyasu, and became a daikan (local governor) of two counties: Hirano and Kawachi.
